channel.title: How to run silabsoft clients/servers with vistas problem
channel.description:
Ok, so I know when i download I have to right click the "run" and use the run as "adminstrater" thing, well whenever I do that this comes up,
"The system cannot find the path specified. The system cannot find the path sepecified. 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. press any key to continue. . ."
So what am I doing wrong, if it makes a diffrence I'm on a laptop, Im using vista, I have the latest Java and Sun downloads, so why is my computer not letting me play it? :confused: I would greatly appriciate it if anyone can help me, thanks.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 26, 2009, 03:46:04 am[/size][hr]bbbbbbbbbbbuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmppppppppppppppppppppppp [br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 26, 2009, 03:47:39 am[/size][hr]Oh and when i try to run a server it just says
"'Java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable progran or batch file"

item.title: How to run silabsoft clients/servers with vistas problem
item.dc:creator: @ak226688 ak226688
item.description:
@ak226688 wrote:

[quote=“monkeyboiii, post:1, topic:275706”]Ok, so I know when i download I have to right click the “run” and use the run as “adminstrater” thing, well whenever I do that this comes up,

“The system cannot find the path specified.
The system cannot find the path sepecified.
‘java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
press any key to continue. . .”

So what am I doing wrong, if it makes a diffrence I’m on a laptop, Im using vista, I have the latest Java and Sun downloads, so why is my computer not letting me play it? I would greatly appriciate it if anyone can help me, thanks.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 26, 2009, 03:46:04 am[/size][hr]bbbbbbbbbbbuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmppppppppppppppppppppppp
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 26, 2009, 03:47:39 am[/size][hr]Oh and when i try to run a server it just says

“‘Java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable progran or batch file”[/quote]set your variables if you havent then right clik edit and change it to your version

Read full topic
